metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2625 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL. This attack requires permission to create non-temporary objects in at least one schema, the ability to lure or wait for an administrator to create or update an affected extension in that schema, and the ability to lure or wait for a victim to use the object targeted in CREATE OR REPLACE or CREATE IF NOT EXISTS. Given all three prerequisites, this flaw allows an attacker to run arbitrary code as the victim role, which may be a superuser.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. rodrigo-zaiden> PostgreSQL 9.5 is not being maintained by upstream anymore (EOL), and without upstream support, there is a potential risk of adding regressions as the fix touches command permissions that might need other changes for a specific version. So, for this version, we won't be fixing this CVE.

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
